H0.text: Winter is the season whose beginning experiences the shortest period of daylight hours.

H1.text: Spring is the season whose beginning experiences the shortest period of daylight hours.

H2.text: Summer is the season whose beginning experiences the shortest period of daylight hours.

H3.text: Autumn is the season whose beginning experiences the shortest period of daylight hours.

A4.text: The winter solstice is the day with the shortest period of daylight and longest night of the year for the hemisphere experiencing it.

A5.text: Traditionally, in many temperate regions, the winter solstice is seen as the middle of winter.

A6.text: In astronomical reckoning by hours of daylight alone, the solstices and equinoxes are in the middle of the respective seasons.

A7.text: Solar timing is based on insolation in which the solstices and equinoxes are seen as the midpoints of the seasons.
